snippet: An internal State Department assessment says the Islamic State’s social message machine is trumping efforts by the Obama administration and its foreign allies to combat it.
abstract: Internal assessment by State Dept indicates broad failure in attempt to use social media to undermine Islamic State; department officials effectively concede that efforts by coalition of wealthy, technologically advanced countries cannot compete with incessant messages supporting violent jihadist movement.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and MICHAEL R. GORDON

lead_paragraph: An internal State Department assessment says the Islamic State’s social message machine is trumping efforts by the Obama administration and its foreign allies to combat it.

headline.main: ISIS Is Winning the Social Media War, U.S. Concludes
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sees Failure in Fighting ISIS on Social Media

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
